newsitem.title: USA: Va. Power sees 552 MW coal unit up early Nov.
newsitem.headline: Va. Power sees 552 MW coal unit up early Nov.

text.p: Virginia Power said Monday a 552 megawatt coal-fired unit at Mount Storm, Va., generating facility was scheduled to resume service on Nov 9 after being shut for seasonal maintenance on Sept 7.
Technical crews were performing repairs on the unit's turbine and boiler, said company spokesman Jonathan Rhudy, adding "This type of work is done every two years."
Two other similar-sized power units on site continued to operate. "Both of them are running fine," he said.
Virginia Power, a subsidiary of Dominion Resources Inc, serves 1.9 million customers in Virginia and North Carolina.
